newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-ROTOR BEAT STRUGGLING CSKA TO GO SECOND.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROTOR BEAT STRUGGLING CSKA TO GO SECOND.

text.p: Rotor Volgograd spoiled CSKA's home debut at their newly renovated Moscow ground by easily turning over the Russian army team 2-0 on Wednesday.

CSKA, playing their first game at the Peschanaya stadium since 1994, had little answer to a strong Volgograd side who moved into second place behind champions Spartak. CSKA slumped to one spot above the relegation zone.

Denis Zubko scored both goals. The Russian international opened his account in the 22nd minute when he slipped the ball past onrushing CSKA goalkeeper Igor Kutepov, then beat him again with a neat header four minutes later.
With Spartak and Dynamo Moscow not playing, Rotor took advantage by leapfrogging the latter and easing into second place, a point behind the champions.
Last year's runners-up Alania Vladikavkaz, 3-0 winners over CSKA last week, continued their inconsistent run, going down 1-0 to Zenit in St Petersburg.
